data.text: A small apartment next to the magazine in a ship of war, in which lights for illuminating the magazine are placed behind thick glass windows, to avoid danger from carrying fire among the explosives. Also called <internalXref urlencoded="light-box">light-box</internalXref>.
The room at the top of a lighthouse containing the lighting apparatus.
A small room from which the magazine of a naval vessel is lighted, being separated from the magazine by heavy glass windows.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: A small <xref>room</xref> from which the <xref>magazine</xref> of a <xref>naval</xref> <xref>vessel</xref> is <xref>lighted</xref>, being separated from the magazine by heavy glass <xref>windows</xref>.
